intro: Ctenium glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular ctenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive texture and appearance. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Ctenium glandulosum is typically herbaceous, with a life cycle that includes flowering and seed production during the warmer months.
